page.title: 14Sunninghill School
page.content: Our school, a{Preparatory day school, has 140 boys and girls aged 5-13. We are very smart in our scarlet blazers and grey skirts or trousers. The Headmistress since 1969 has been {Miss. J.Norton.}There are 19 staff, mostly ladies. The main building is a post Victorian house, with many modern extensions in the large garden. Our facilities are good, especially in the laboratory and art-room. Music is very important in school. We have a BBC computer with disc-drive and printer. We have to work hard and are given homework each day except Friday. Many pupils take Common Entrance exams and go on to Public schools. This is a private fee-paying school and pupils come from up to 15 miles away. We all stay for lunch, cooked or packed. Cooked lunch is a set menu and is usually very good.
